body_html:
@bleedingfight Hi, thanks for the post. You have to use cuDNN 7 with CUDA 9 for any tensorflow-gpu version from 1.5 to 1.11. I understand from your post that you are using cuDNN5.1 with CUDA 9 which is not a preferred combination inorder to use tensorflow on Ubuntu.
For more information on the version compatibility, please find Tested build configurations table in this link.

@bleedingfight Hi, thanks for the post. You have to use cuDNN 7 with CUDA 9 for any tensorflow-gpu version from 1.5 to 1.11. I understand from your post that you are using cuDNN5.1 with CUDA 9 which is not a preferred combination inorder to use tensorflow on Ubuntu.
For more information on the version compatibility, please find Tested build configurations table in this link.
body:
@bleedingfight Hi, thanks for the post. You have to use cuDNN 7 with CUDA 9 for any tensorflow-gpu version from 1.5 to 1.11. I understand from your post that you are using cuDNN5.1 with CUDA 9 which is not a preferred combination inorder to use tensorflow on Ubuntu. 
For more information on the version compatibility, please find **Tested build configurations** table in [this link.](https://www.tensorflow.org/install/source#tested_build_configurations)
